ing: 1 (16 ounce) package roll sausage, such as Jimmy DeanÂ®
1 tablespoon warm water, or more as needed
des: "My mother grew up in Australia and made these for me all the time. They are certainly the most delicious sausage rolls you will ever eat!"
ins:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.
Mix sausage, bread crumbs, onion, paprika, and garlic powder together in a bowl.
Tear bread slices into pieces and place in a bowl; add 1 tablespoon warm water to moisten. Add to sausage mixture; stir until well combined.
Unfold puff pastry sheet; roll out to to an approximately 16x12-inch rectangle. Cut the sheet lengthwise into 3 equal sections and transfer to the prepared baking sheet. Mix beaten egg with 1 tablespoon water and glaze all edges of pastry sections.
Divide sausage mixture into 3 equal portions. Spread 1 portion down the middle of each pastry strip. Roll pastry edges up and pinch together, forming 3 long pastry-covered sausages. Turn rolls over and glaze with egg mixture. Slice each roll into 8 equal portions.
Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 20 minutes.
